page.title: 04Local customs
page.content: Many old customs have died out, but some remain and are as popular and well supported as they used to be. The harvest festival is well attended and this is usually followed, a day or so later, by the harvest supper. These are attended by many people who are not normally church goers, and the auction of harvest produce at the end of the evening is a very happy time. This auction helps to raise much needed funds for the upkeep of the church. When there is a death most people attend the funeral as a sign of respect for the deceased and sympathy for the bereaved family. Most funerals are reported in the local press, with a full list of names of those who attended.
